column1: Warburg was an important leader of the American Jewish Joint Distribution Committee
column2: established to help the Jews in Europe in the period leading up to
column4: the Great Depression. Warburg actively raised funds in the United States on behalf of European Jews who faced hunger following World War I. As early as 1919
column5: he was quoted in The New York Times discussing the dire situation of Jewish war sufferers.Warburg served as the founder and first president of the American Friends of the Hebrew University
column6: which supports the Hebrew University of Jerusalem in Jerusalem
